page.title: 06Inside Ashton Windmill
page.content: Inside the tower of Ashton Windmill on the bottom floor is a large wooden wheel with cogs called a spur wheel.There is a brake on it to stop the shaft which runs from top to bottom turning.Up some wooden steps are the two large grindstones which the shaft turns.The corn is put between them and the top one turns round.The bags of corn are put on a hook and pulled through three trapdoors to the top where it is put in a shute which goes to the grindstones.The top of the windmill is the 'engine room' which makes everything happen.The sails outside are attached to the shaft by large cog wheels.There is a brake switch to stop the sails turning too quickly in a strong wind.The whole cap can be turned so that it faces the way the wind is blowing.
